-Wpointer-arith -Wcast-align -Woverloaded-virtual -Wsynth -Wno-ctor-dtor-privacy
-Wno-non-virtual-dtor -Wno-long-long -pedantic -fshort-wchar -pthread -pipe 
-DNDEBUG -DTRIMMED -ffunction-sections -march=athlon-xp -mtune=athlon-xp -msse
-funit-at-a-time -funroll-loops -fpeel-loops -funswitch-loops -O2 -pipe
-fomit-frame-pointer -freorder-blocks -fno-reorder-functions -gstabs+ -DXTHREADS
-D_REENTRANT -DXUSE_MTSAFE_API -I/usr/include/gtk-2.0 -I/usr/lib/gtk-2.0/include

comments.creator: gpp666_999@yahoo.de
comments.raw_text:
You could try and --enable-system-svg, by default the build uses the own cairo
build and after that pulls the system wide, because of pango. If pango is
enabled the build should disable its own cairo version.
comments.text:
You could try and --enable-system-svg, by default the build uses the own cairo
build and after that pulls the system wide, because of pango. If pango is
enabled the build should disable its own cairo version.
comments.author: gpp666_999@yahoo.de

comments.creator: opi@gmx.at
comments.raw_text:
I'm compiling on OpenSUSE 10.0RC1 and they compiled pango with cairo on system.

I can use --diasable-pango in my mozconfig but I can do what I want I get the
same error message, cause the pango depends on a newer version of cairo.

So what else may help to get a functional --enable-cairo build?
comments.text:
